definition[0]: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based
definition[1]: to introduce or start a system, rule, legal process etc
example[2]: We had no choice but to institute court proceedings against the airline.
definition[2]: an official organization that represents people of a particular profession
example[3]: the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants
definition[3]: an official organization concerned with research or education
definition[4]: to introduce a new system or rule
example[6]: The bank instituted a number of cost-cutting measures.
example[7]: The firm instituted a program to provide retirement benefits for its staff.
